sentences: Ta ei arvanud seda olevat t√µsi.
context: The word 'arvasid' is the 2nd person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'arvama', which means to think, believe, or assume. It's commonly used when referring to what someone thought in the past. The base form 'arvama' conjugates as 'arvan' (I), 'arvad' (you), 'arvas' (he/she), 'arasime' (we), 'arasite' (you pl.), 'arasid' (they).
